intro: Dentaria trifolia, commonly known as three-leaved toothplant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and罂粟. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features trifoliate leaves with three ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive seed pods that split open to release seeds when mature.
